results.title: Porklips now
results.brief_description: Starring William Gray, Ernie Fosselius, John Brent, Mark Lee, Jim Turner. A comedy which casts a running loop parody over ‘Apocalypse Now’. Features Martin Sheen lookalike William Gray as “Dullard” who is sent to deal with a renegade butcher whose low, low prices threaten the profits of the Meatcutters Protective Association.

results.title: Art makes people
results.creator_credit: Rona Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A film designed to show that the experience of art education has an important place in the growth of the individual. The film is highly stylised and shows a young child growing and moving through a series of “rooms” encountering various art/educational experiences until she/he emerges to face the world. Includes original music composed and performed by Jim Beattie.

results.title: Beginning silk screening on fabric (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brenton Holmes, Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.) and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program demonstrates the basic procedures for silk-screening on to fabric using paper stencils. Building a frame, attaching the silk, preparing stencils and making a two-colour print are shown

results.title: Bert Flugelman: public sculptor (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lesley Hammond, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: The work of Bert Flugelman is presented, particularly the design and casting of his famous sculpture pieces in Martin Place, Sydney, in Canberra and in Adelaide. His work in other mediums, e.g. pottery and painting is also presented, demonstrating the process of sculpture construction.

results.title: Nails
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Phillip Borsos
results.brief_description: A non-narrated look at the manufacture of nails, juxtaposing highly mechanised factory production with the slower outputs of a small business and a single blacksmith. The blacksmith is seen labouring at his forge, shaping nails from single strands of steel rods. The scene shifts from this peaceful setting to the roar of a twentieth century mill, where banks of machines draw, cut and pound the steel rods faster than the eye can follow. These diametrically opposed scenes emphasise the changed relationship between the individual and his work. (Awards: New York, Chicago, Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Phillip Borsos

results.title: Power and the land
results.creator_credit: United States. Film Service, United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Joris Ivens
results.brief_description: Sensitive portrayal of American ideals and lifestyles, made to explain and promote the Department of Agriculture’s program of rural electrification. Filmed on the farm of Bill and Hazel Parkinson in St. Clairsville, Ohio, capturing the hardship of a nonelectrified farm and the progress and profit brought by electricity. The film is critical of the reluctance by public utility companies to install power to rural areas. A significant documentary that elevates the status of farmers and the value of their work. Cinematography, Floyd Crosby and Arthur Ornitz. Script, Edwin Locke. Editing, Helen van Dongen. Commentary by Stephen Vincent Benet. Music, Douglas Moore.

results.title: The Clown
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cohn, Richard Balducci and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A shaggy dog, Clown, lives in Paris with a street urchin: the two are inseparable. One day Clown runs off while the boy plays with friends. Using a painting of Clown, the boy desperately tries to find his dog. He has nearly given up when he at last sees clown and rushes to embrace it. Joy turns to despair as the boy realises the dog has attached itself to a blind man. The boy walks away.

results.title: The Conductor. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, South Australian Film Corporation and Milton Ingerson
results.brief_description: A look at the art and technique of the conductor. In part two, conductor Verdon Williams discusses the tasks that a conductor must do before each performance - choosing the number and type of instruments needed; studying the melody and style of the music. Shows him rehearsing an orchestra and a choir.

results.title: To everything there is a season
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation and Brian Bosisto
results.brief_description: A general interest film exposing one of South Australia’s wildlife sanctuaries located at the Coorong. It instructively illustrates the interaction between the birds and the landscape against a backdrop of seasonal change. Of particular interest to students of the life sciences, conservationists and bird-watching societies. Narrated by John and Judith Dick.

results.title: Time to share
results.brief_description: Shows how voluntary workers undertake community work. Shows community aides working with underprivileged children, the sick, the elderly, migrants and unemployed teenagers. The community aides explain why they became voluntary community workers and outline the personal satisfaction they receive by giving their time to those who need assistance.
